result.execSummary:
The defendant Amy Nicole Garcia was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

--The Court orders the Defendant to comply with DNA sample provision.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Amy Nicole Garcia

records.addlTxt: Letter from Att Huebner regarding billable hours

records.addlTxt:
[ml] Cases 21CF470 and 22CF66 called at 8:57AM
Defendant Amy Nicole Garcia in court with attorney Karl E Huebner. DA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.
These files are scheduled for Status Conference and Preliminary hearing, however Att Huebner files Prelim Waiver and resolution paperwork prior to the case being called.

The Court proceeds with a Preliminary Hearing waiver in file 22CF66:
Ms. Garcia waives her right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds her over for Trial.

Arraignment:
--service of Information admitted, reading waived
--the charges and maximum penalties are recited

--------------------------------------------------

The Court proceeds with Plea and Sentencing for both files:

Maximum penalties are recited; Constitutional rights are reviewed; plea of " NO CONTEST " entered as to Count #1 in file 21CF470, and Counts #1 and #2 in file 22CF66; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance is verified.  The Court accepts the plea, finds the Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Count #2 in file 21CF470 and Counts #3, #4, #5, and #6 in file 22CF66. Additionally, The Court reads-in and dismisses an uncharged offense (DA Case #21JE1858, Date of Offense: on or about 11/25/20, theft related charge)

As to file 21CF470:
On Count #1, the Court withholds sentence and places the Defendant on Probation for 3 years.

As to file 22CF66:
On Count #1, the Court sentences the Defendant to:
--serve 5 days in Jefferson County Jail, with Huber privileges; to commence FORTHWITH
--0 days credit for time already served given
--Ms. Garcia is required to report for commencement and service of jail sentence with absolute sobriety and without non-prescribed controlled substances in system; non-compliance will result in loss of Huber privileges without further process.
--pay costs plus DNA surcharge
The Court orders the Defendant to comply with DNA sample provision. 

On Count #2, the Court withholds sentence and places the Defendant on Probation for 3 years.

Conditions of Probation include:
--to serve 90 days in the Jefferson County Jail, with work-release privileges, to commence after the jail sentence in file 22CF66. The Court authorizes transfer of this sentence to another County as long as the receiving county accepts the transfer and that the sentence be served in the same way that it would be served in Jefferson County (no electronic monitoring).  **APPLIES TO COUNT #1 IN FILE 21CF470** 
--Ms. Garcia is required to report for commencement and service of jail term with absolute sobriety and without non-prescribed controlled substances in system; non-compliance will result in loss of work-release privileges without further process.
--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment per Agent
--to undergo any other assessment, treatment, or counseling per Agent
--attempt to obtain/maintain employment and/or education program per Agent
--comply with drug testing per Agent
--to comply with DNA sample provision and surcharge
--pay all costs, fees, surcharges and restitution

The Court notes that the Defendant is not eligible for special disposition or expungement for these offenses.
The Court sets restitution at $1,270.00, payable to the Victim in uncharged DA file #21JE1858.
The Court sets restitution at $309.42, payable to Jefferson Walmart in file 22CF66.

The Court orders the DOC to assess and collect costs and restitution while the Defendant is on supervision.

Days credit for time already served: 0 days as to all Counts in both files

Felony Firearm/Civil Rights Warning given

recess 9:32AM

Pre-trial conference on March 9, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on March 25, 2022 at 08:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Amy Nicole Garcia
Current: 1028 Meadowood Lane, Jefferson, WI 53549 United States  (Effective: 02-17-2022)
Prior: 929 Rosemary Ct, Jefferson, WI 53549

Initial Appearance occurs in Case 22CF66:
Defendant verifies date of birth; updates address to: 1028 Meadowood Lane Jefferson
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charges and maximum penalties are recited
Preliminary Hearing time limits are waived by both parties.

The Court requires a $1500   Signature Bond, with condition:

recess: 11:10am  

NEXT:   (1) Pretrial Conference on 3/9/22 at 10:00am    (2) Status Conference(21CF470)/Preliminary Hearing(22CF66) on 3/25/22 at 8:30am
